article.headline: UNLV 91, Auburn 87
article.story: AUBURN, Ala. (AP) -- Jerel Blassingame scored nine of his 20 points in overtime as UNLV rallied from an 11-deficit to beat Auburn 91-87 on Sunday. Louis Amundson had a career-high 22 points and 22 rebounds. Odartey Blankson added 21 and grabbed 10 rebounds for the Running Rebels. The Tigers (6-3) cut the lead to 86-84 with an Ian Young 3-pointer. But Blassingame added a couple of free throws and Blankson hit a layup to put the game out of reach. The Running Rebels (3-3), who have won four straight games over Auburn, outrebounded the Tigers 63-35 and had more points in the paint with a 54-34 edge. After Auburn lost a double-digit lead, Auburn tied the game at 75 with a Brett Howell 3-pointer with 10 seconds remaining. The Tigers finished the first half with a 41-40 lead, highlighted by a Nathan Watson steal and layup. Auburn took a five-point lead at 4:32 in the first half when Young hit a 3 for its largest lead. Even though UNLV shot 2 for 16 from beyond the arch in the first half, they used their height advantage in the paint, outscoring the Tigers 32-14. The Rebels also ended a four game road trip, finishing with a 2-2 record. Tony Douglas had 21 points and Nathan Watson added 16 for Auburn. Quinnel Brown scored 14 and had nine rebounds for the Tigers.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
